definition: to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: The teenager had been detained after the traffic incident.
sentences.chinese: 当时少年曾由于那起交通事故被暂时羁留。

sentences.english: Thus ended one man's sojourn in this world.
sentences.chinese: 一个人羁留尘世的生涯结束了。

sentences.english: After release, detainees are subject to a statutory supervision period of one year.
sentences.chinese: 羁留者获释后须接受为期一年的法定监管。

sentences.english: Theatre affairs kept me in Shanghai.
You may request that your relatives or a friend be informed of your detention.
sentences.chinese: 你可要求通知你的亲属或一位朋友你已被羁留。

sentences.english: Detainees shall occupy accommodation within a detention centre as directed by the superintendent.
sentences.chinese: 被羁留者须住在羁留中心内监督所指定的住所。

sentences.english: Detainees shall occupy accommodation within a detention centre as directed by the superintendent.
sentences.chinese: 被羁留者须住在羁留中心内监督所指定的住所。

sentences.english: Provided that he shall not be so confined for more than 7 days without his consent.
sentences.chinese: 但未经该被羁留者同意，不得将他如此拘禁超过7天。

definition: to live in a foreign place/to live somewhere as a guest
to die in a foreign land/to die abroad
to imprison/to place under house arrest
one's office/place where one holds a post
in custody/to keep sb in detention
to visit (a patient, prisoner etc)/to look inquiringly
to exile/to banish/to deport/to float (logs) downstream
